channel.title: Starter
channel.description: So ive made a command starter that gives u 25m and 5000 sharks. But the prob is: they can do it any time they want. So how can i make that they only can do it 1 time? (code for money: 995 and code for sharks: 386) Please help, thanks!

item.title: Starter
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

[quote=“durial12, post:7, topic:334476”]@WowILikeToCode

True dat.[/quote]

Thx

Read full topic

item.title: Starter
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

[quote=“durial12, post:5, topic:334476”]Thats just about correct, but your going to need to tell the server what starter is equal to in the first place (because I’m guessing it doesn’t do so already), so at the top of your client.java with the other ints your going to have to add:

int starter = 0

and you will need to add the tokens into your character file.

open client.java and search for height untill you see something like this

} else if (token.equals("character-height")) { height = Integer.parseInt(token2);
below that add this

} else if (token.equals("character-starter")) { starter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Enjoy!

Read full topic

item.title: Starter
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Death Owner Death
item.description:
@Owner_Death wrote:

if (starter == 0) { // Starter kit starter = 1; showInterface(3559); apset = true; addItem(556, 300); //Air Runes addItem(558, 300);//Mind Runes addItem(554, 100);//Fire Runes addItem(884, 100); //Iron arrows addItem(841, 1);//shortbow addItem(1323, 1);//Iron Scimitar addItem(1115, 1);//Iron Platebody addItem(1067, 1);//Iron Platelegs addItem(1007, 1);//cape //addItem("ITEMID, ITEM AMOUNT); sM("You only get one starter kit!"); }

This is my starter kit. Basically it says that if in my Characters file starter=0 then it gives them starter and then turns starter line into starter=1.
Hope you understand I’m not very good at explaining. (Or programming for that matter)
Not Really Sure but maybe you could try this:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") && starter == 0) { sendMessage("Heres your starter!"); addItem(996,25000000); addItem(387,5000); starter == 1; }

This would be the first thing I would try. I’m still a noob coder so if it doesn’t work Sorry.
BTW I do know that you don’t need && playerRights >=0 because that just says that if your a regular player or above which is redundant.

Read full topic
